intro: Olyra latifolia var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-leaved olyra, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, smooth leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
